発音 インヴァイロメント
opt: optional - [形] 必須ではない, 選択可能な, 任意の
parallel: [形] 平行の, [動] 平行している，同時に起こる
permit: [動] 許可する, 可能にする
handle: [動] 処理する, 対処する
archive: [動] (文書を)保管する, [名] 記録保管所
repository: [名] 貯蔵庫, 保管する場所
expand: [動] 拡大する, 広げる
extend: [動] 伸ばす, 長くする
encounter: [動] 偶然出会う, 遭遇する
specify: [動] 明確に述べる, 指定する
comply: compliance - [名] (規則などに)従うこと, 追従
avail: [動] 利用する, 役立つ
post: [動] 掲示する / 投函する, 郵送する / (部署に)配置する
[接頭辞] ～の後, ～の次, 対義語 pre
verify: [動] 検証する, 裏付けをとる (正しいかどうか)
validate: [動] 確認する, 認証する (要件を満たしているか)
confirm: 発音 コンファーム
deploy: [動] 展開する, 配置する
demand: [動] 要求する, [名] 要求
on demand - 要求に応じて
invalid: [形] 無効な, 効力のない
enclose: [動] 囲む, 包み込む, 同封する
infer: [動] 推測する, 察する
effect: [動] 引き起こす, [名] 効果, 影響
effectively - [副] 事実上, 効果的に
necessary: [形] 必要な, 不可欠な
発音 ネッセッセァリ
compatible: [形] 互換性がある, 相容れる
accept: [動] 受け入れる, 了承する
represent: [動] 代表する, 代理する
unlikely: [形] ありそうにない, 可能性が低い
peek: [動] ちらっと見る, こっそり見る
sequence: [名] 順序, 連続 [動] 順番に並べる
suitable: [形] 適切な, ふさわしい
describe: [動] 説明する, 描写する
transact: [動] 取引する, 処理する
発音 トランザクト
transaction - [名] (業務の)処理, 取引
assert: [動] 断言する, 主張する
transient: [形] 一時的な, はかない
serial: [形] 連続的な, ひと続きの
serialize - [動] 直列化, 一列に並べる
flush: [動] 赤面する, (水を)どっと流す
bundle: [名] 束, [動] 束ねる, かたまりにする
inherit: [動] 受け継ぐ, 継承する
extract: [動] 抽出する, 抜き取る
Subject: 主語 (単語の役割)

kind of: ちょっと, なんとなく, まぁね
how many: どのくらいたくさんの
How do you do?: はじめまして, ごきげんよう
(手渡すときに) はいどうぞ
feel free to: ご自由に, 遠慮なく～して
over there: あそこに, 向こうに
come on: 来て / さあさあ / 頑張って
look up: 見上げる, (辞書などを)調べる, 尊敬する
look back: 回想する, 追憶する
I see: なるほど, わかった, そっか
that's too bad: お気の毒に, 残念ですね
皮肉的なニュアンスになってしまう場合がある
you guys: あなたたち (カジュアル)
These days: 最近 (過去と対比した現在)
look forward to: toの後ろは、名詞か動名詞になる
get lost: 道に迷う, 迷子になる
on time: 時間通りに, 定刻に
In time: 時間内に, 時間に間に合う
as far as: [接] ～する限り (知見や記憶の範囲)
even though: たとえ～だとしても (事実)
even if: たとえ～だとしても (仮定)
as if: [接] まるで〜であるかのように
so that: [接] 〜するために, ～できるように
be about to: ちょうど～するところだ
jadging from A: Aから判断すれば [独立分詞構文]
generally speaking: 一般的に言って [独立分詞構文]
speaking of A: Aといえば (関連の話に繋ぐ) [独立分詞構文]
compared with A: Aと比べると [独立分詞構文]
see also: こちらも参照, 関連項目

What ~ !: なんて～なんだ! (名詞を含む語句)
How ~ !: なんて～なんだ! (形容詞or副詞)
How do you like ~: 〜はどうですか？ (感想を尋ねる)
How do you like the taste?
be過去形 ~ing: When I got home, my sister was watching TV.
be動詞 going to 原形: I am going to visit Australia next summer.
Are you going to visit Australia next summer?
My father is not going to buy a car next month.
will 原形: ～するつもり (その場で決めたこと)
Will he play baseball next Sunday?
He will not play baseball next Sunday.
~, so ~: I have a test tomorrow, so I am studying now.
I don't have a bike, so I'll walk to the station.
理由は前述できない (繋いでいるだけ)
because ~: I am studing because I have a test tomorrow.
Because I have a test tomorrow, I am studying.
理由を前述できる (後述することが多い)
that ~: I think that Chiese food is delisiouse.
know that ~: I know that life is not easy.
believe that ~: We believe that he is right.
say that ~: She says that we do not have homework today.
must: ～しなければならない [助動詞]
have to: Do I have to study English?
not have to: I do not have to study English.
may: May I use your cell phone?
should: ～したほうがよい, ～すべき [助動詞]
You should go to see a docter.
Shall we ~ ?: Shall we play baseball with us?
May/Can I ~ ?: ～しても良いですか (許可を求める)
Will/Can you ~ ?: Will you show me your notebook?
Would/Could you ~ ?: ～してくれませんか (丁寧に依頼)
助動詞を過去形にする
Would you show me your notebook?
I would like to: I would like to have a pizza.
there is/are ~: There are two new students in our class.
Is there any library at that corner?
There is not any library at that corner.
名詞 to 原形: 形容詞的用法 (名詞を詳しく説明)
Do you have anything to eat?
to 原形 [副詞的用法]: My brother went to Sydoney to study art.
To see bill, we will go to India next week.
~est in/of ~: ～(単数/複数)の中で最も [最上級]
Tokyo is the largest sity in the world.
Nile river is the longest of all rivers.
more ~ than ~: Takoyaki is more delisious than Okonomiyaki.
most ~: Mt.Fuji is the most beatiful mountain in Japan.
Ichiro runs as fast as Jiro.
Ichiro does not run as fast as Jiro.
less ~ than ~: This camera is less expensive than that one.
least ~: That camera is the least expensive here.
be動詞 現在分詞: 今～しているところ [現在進行形]
be動詞 過去分詞 (by ~): I was given this watch by him.
This car is used by my father.
have 過去分詞: 継続, 完了, 経験 を表す [現在完了]
[継続] I have lived in Tokyo for three years.
[完了] I have just finished my homework.
[経験] I have never eaten the fruit.
have been: ずっと居る, ずっと～している [継続]
Jack has been in Japan since 2012.
have gone to: 行ってしまった, 行ったところ [完了]
My brother has already gone to the airport.
have been to: 行ったことがある [経験]
I have been to Canada twice.
have been ~ing: ずっと～している [現在完了進行形]
I have been studing English for five houres.
How long have you been studing English?
疑問文 + not(短縮形): ～ではないですか [否定疑問文]
- No, he isn't. (インド出身ではない)
返答はnotではなく、肯定文に対してされる
~, be/do/助動詞(肯否を逆) 主語 ?: ～だ。 そうですよね？ [付加疑問文]
疑問詞 主語 動詞: Yes/No で答えられる文 [間接疑問文]
文中に疑問文が埋め込まれているもの
I don't know, who you are.
Do you know where she lives?
I didn't know who he was.
It is ~ (for 人) to 原形: ～することは(人 にとって)～です [不定詞]
It is hard for me to study English at home by myself.
It is dangerous to walk around here at midnight.
want 人 to 原形: I want you to see the new movie.
ask 人 to 原形: My mother asked me to go shopping.
tell 人 to 原形: My father told me to come home early.
疑問詞 to 原形: I don't know how to start this game.
I don't know what to do.
Did you decide where to go on school trip?
too ~ to 原形: This problem is too difficult (for me) to answer.
so ~ that ~ cannot: This problem is so difficult that I cannot answer it.
enough to 原形: John is rich enough to buy the house.
so ~ that ~ can: John is so rich that he can buy the house.
let 人 原形不定詞: Will you let me open the box?
help 人 原形不定詞: I helped my father cook diner.
He helped the lady carry her bag.
形容句 名詞: [前置修飾] 分詞が単語の場合に使用
名詞 形容句: [後置修飾] 分詞がセットの場合に使用
That is the window broken by Tom.
名詞 関係代名詞 節: 2つの文を繋げ、名詞を修飾する
[主格] I lost my pen which I always use.
[目的格] She is a girl (who) I met every morning.
[所有格] I was friend whose uncle was prime minister.
(最上級) This is the best movie that I have ever seen.
関係代名詞 who / whom / whose / which / that
if 過去文, 助動詞の過去文: もし～だったら、～ [仮定法/現在]
「可能性の低いこと」 を仮定する文
If I were you, I would ask my teacher.
If 過去完了の文, 助動詞(過)+完了の文: もし～だったら、...だったのに。[仮定法/過去]
If he had studied harder, he might have passed the test.
If shouldの文, 助動詞の文: 万一～だったら、...でしょう。[仮定法/未来]
If it should rains tomorrow, the picnic would be canceld.
If S were to ~, 助動詞の過去文: 仮に～だとしたら、...でしょう。
If you were to win the lottery, wat would you do?
wish 仮定法: He wishes he had studied more.
as if 仮定法: He looks as if he had seen a ghost.
with ~, 助動詞の過去文(+完了): With more time, we could achieve the goal.
Without ~, 助動詞の過去文(+完了): Without your help, we would not have succeeded.
...; otherwise, 助動詞の過去文(+完了): He is an honest man; otherwise, we would not trust him.
be able to: ～できる, する能力がある
You will be able to see the Tokyo Tower from the new office.
It is better to 〜: It is better not to make noise.
ought to 原形: You ought to pay him the money by next week.
had better 原形: You had better see a doctor.
used to 原形: There used to be a small park here.
would (often) 原形: They would often have picnics in the park on sunny day.
must have 過去分詞: [!] had to (～しなければならなかった) とは別
You must have seen the movie, too.
cannot have 過去分詞: [!] could not (～できなかった) とは別
You cannot have been there yesterday.
should have 過去分詞: ～するべきだった (していない)
I should have brought an umbrella.
be being 過去分詞: That bridge is being built by them.
It is better to ~: It is better not to make noise while the baby is sleeping.
使役動詞 O 原形不定詞: 使役動詞 : make (強制), let (許可), have (役割)
The coach made the team members plactice every morning.
My mother let us stay up late tonight.
The professor had the assistant make a hotel reservation.
知覚動詞 O 原形不定詞: ～するのが 見える/聞こえる(など)
I saw something move outside the window.
I heard someone call my name.
in order to do: in order は無くても良い
so as to do とほぼ同じ
In order to pass the test, you must study header.
so as to do: ～するために(目的/結果を表す)
She opened the curtain so as to see outside.
have/get O 分詞(C): O が ～ している(現分)/された(過分) 状態にする
They had their house painted in blue.
make O 分詞(C): O が～された状態にする
He tried to make himself underestood.
接続詞+主語 が省略される表現
Walked in the park, I saw beautiful flowers.
with O 分詞: 口に食べ物が入ったまま話さないで。
Don't talk with your mouth filled with food.
whatever: [複合関係代名詞] (1)～は何でも, (2)何が～しても
何が～しても  =  no matter what
(1) I will give you whatever you want.
(2) Whatever happends, we will win the game tomorrow.
whoever: [複合関係代名詞] (1)～は誰でも, (2)誰が～しようとも
(2)誰が～しようとも  =  no matter who
(1) I will hier whoever you recommend.
(2) Whoever you are, you must follow the rule.
whichever: [複合関係代名詞] (1)～はどれでも, (2)どれが～しても
どれが～しても  =  no matter which
(2) Whichever team wins, the fans will enjoy the game.
wherever: [複合関係副詞] (1)～するところはどこでも, (2)どこで～しようとも
(1) ～するところはどこでも  =  at any place where
(2) どこで～しようとも  =  no matter where
(1) Tim followed his grandma wherever she went.
(2) Wherever you hide yourself, I will find you in the end.
whenever: [複合関係副詞] (1)～するときはいつでも, (2) いつ～しようとも
(1) ～するときはいつでも  =  at any time when
(2) いつ～しようとも  =  no matter when
(1) I feel relaxed whenever I listen to this song.
(2) Whenever you come, I'm glad to meet you.
however: However hard you try, you cannot change the past.
比較級 and 比較級: だんだん～,  どんどん～
It's getting colder and colder these day.
The highter you climb, the cooler it get.
What do you think ~ ?: What do you think she has?
none of the ~: None of the books were interesting.
It is ... that ~: → It was a new car that he bought.
疑問詞 on earth: What on earth are you doing?
疑問詞 in the world: What in the world are you doing?
否定語 + 疑問文の形: He [not only] won the race, but he also set a record.
→ [Not only] <did he win> the race, but he also set a record.
副詞句 V S: [倒置] 場所などは文頭に置くことができる
It is ~ that: ...することは～だ [形式主語/仮主語]
「It is ~ to 不定詞」 と異なり、主語を入れることができる
It is important that (S)you eat healthy food.

read: リード レッド レッド
write: ライト ロート リテン
catch: キャッチ カート カート
begin: ビギン ビギャン ビガン
hear: ヒア ハード ハード
choose: チューズ チョーズ チョーゼン
fly: フライ フルウ フローン
drive: ドライヴ ドローヴ ドリヴン
